action->Tug.name: Tug
action->Tug.description:
The bregdi pulls a creature it can reach or a creature holding something it can reach (such as a fishing line in the water).

The bregdi attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, it pulls the creature into an adjacent space. On a critical success, the bregdi can also make a jaws Strike against the creature pulled into an adjacent space.

Burning Chandelier Trap.name: Burning Chandelier Trap
Burning Chandelier Trap.description: Four large flaming chandeliers swing wildly around the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:36|name:Disable a Chandelier|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a chandelier or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 33) to permanently drain the magic from a chandelier. Any amount of cold damage that overcomes a chandelier's cold resistance extinguishes its flames and removes its persistent fire damage and flame dart attack. @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel in the southeast corner of the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no living creatures remaining in the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.routine: (4 actions) For every chandelier disabled, the trap's actions are reduced by 1. For each of the trap's actions, a different chandelier attacks a random creature in the room. A chandelier uses its swinging chandelier attack if it can, but it can't make melee attacks against creatures in the cage, the closet, or the gap between the two double doors leading into the vault. Against a creature it can't reach with a melee attack, it uses a flame dart attack instead. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.
Burning Chandelier Trap.stealth: (master) or @Check[perception|dc:38|traits:action:seek] (master) to spot the trap's control panel

action->Extending Chandeliers.name: Extending Chandeliers
action->Extending Chandeliers.description:
Trigger A creature touches the cage door, the closet door, or any wooden stand

Effect Both double doors leading out of the room shut and lock; while the trap is active, the key doesn't work to open these doors (although their locks can be picked normally). The chandeliers drop several feet on elongated chains, allowing them to swing around the room. The closest chandelier to the triggering creature makes a swinging chandelier Strike against it. The trap then rolls initiative.

weapon->+1 Striking Heavy Crossbow.name: +1 Striking Heavy Crossbow
weapon->+1 Striking Heavy Crossbow.description: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking axiomatic Sc.name: +2 Greater Striking axiomatic Scourge
weapon->+2 Greater Striking axiomatic Sc.description: A scourge-also known as a cat-o'-nine-tails-is a set of several knotted cords made from cotton or leather and attached to a handle. While most scourges are more suitable for torture than combat, the weapons used by the Order of the Scourge have metal barbs woven in to pierce clothing and armor. The scourge is a martial melee weapon.

armor->+2 Resilient Hellknight Plate.name: +2 Resilient Hellknight Plate
armor->+2 Resilient Hellknight Plate.description: Few armors in the Inner Sea region are as memorable as the iconic Hellknight plate. While each order has its own flourishes, Hellknight plate is instantly recognizable to any who know of the Hellknights. Hellknights go to extreme measures to punish non-Hellknights who get their hands on Hellknight plate, and the reward is not usually worth the risk, since for non-Hellknights, the armor is functionally similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Gq1cZWSKOtJhKd2p]{Full Plate}.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Diabolic Certitude.name: Diabolic Certitude
action->Diabolic Certitude.description: When making a Recall Knowledge check about a devil she's observing, whenever Calennia rolls a critical failure, she gets a failure instead.

action->Flog Mercilessly.name: Flog Mercilessly
action->Flog Mercilessly.description: Calennia Strikes with her scourge. On a hit, she rolls damage three times. This damage is combined (for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance, for example).

action->Terrible Justice.name: Terrible Justice
action->Terrible Justice.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Calennia targets the creature with a death knell spell (DC 34). If the target dies, all of Calennia's enemies within 60 feet are targeted by a fear spell (DC 34). A creature that succeeds at either save is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

spell->Project Image (At Will) (See Proj.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0873MWM0qKDDv81O]
Project Image (At Will) (See Project False Image)

spell->Tongues (Constant).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
Tongues (Constant)

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepathy 100 feet

action->Thoughtsense (Imprecise) 120 fee.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.JcaIJLGGmst79f1Y]
Thoughtsense (Imprecise) 120 feet

action->Disgorge Portal.name: Disgorge Portal
action->Disgorge Portal.description:
The camarach vomits a spray of coruscating light. This has the effect of a DC 42 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, except that each creature is affected by one violet beam and one other beam (roll 1d6 instead of 1d8 to determine which other beam).

The camarach can't Disgorge a Portal again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disgorge a Portal]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Exile.name: Exile
action->Exile.description:
The camarach shunts one creature within its body through an inner portal to send it away.

The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is teleported to an open space it chooses within 30 feet of the camarach.

Success The creature isn't teleported.

Failure The creature is teleported to a random open space 1 mile from the camarach.

Critical Failure The creature is teleported to a random other plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}.

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The camarach Grabs a creature

Effect The camarach uses Swallow Whole.

action->Project False Image.name: Project False Image
action->Project False Image.description: When the camarach casts project image, its illusory image can be another creature of its size or a structure of its size that features a large portal (such as a freestanding archway or a large hut with an open doorway).

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Huge, @Damage[(3d10+9)[bludgeoning]] damage, Rupture 34

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Canopy Drop.name: Canopy Drop
Canopy Drop.description: A trapdoor, connected to floor sensors, opens in the section of floor marked on the map, while the surrounding floor suddenly tilts to a 45-degree angle and the fountains in the wall begin spraying at high pressure, making the tile slippery and pushing creatures toward the open chute.
Canopy Drop.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Jam Trapdoor Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the mechanisms and keep the trapdoor from opening, or to locate the bypass switch hidden under a stair riser just outside the room

action->Flush.name: Flush
action->Flush.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures stand on the trapped spaces

Effect One round after the trap is triggered, all creatures in the room fall 40 feet down the shaft to area E36, taking @Damage[20[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall plus @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage as they land in the spiked pit.

The creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to snag the hammock or one of the hanging storage containers to avoid falling.

The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls or Grab an Edge is 20.

Carvey.name: Carvey
Carvey.publicNotes: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life. Though it has no mind, it can still go into a berserk rage when harmed, giving it a faint semblance of emotion. Flesh golems guard the laboratories and charnel houses of fleshwarpers and necromancers who feel no compunctions about desecrating corpses for their own ends. Though the first flesh golem is believed to have been a misguided attempt to create from simple base elements, these monstrosities are far from human. In isolated cases, echoes of a personality might rise in a flesh golem if the brain used as part of its construction belonged to a particularly powerful personality, but such tragic instances are rare in the extreme.

action->Suicidal Obedience.name: Suicidal Obedience
action->Suicidal Obedience.description:
Carvey is unerringly loyal to the Skinsaw cult and to Mobana especially. When Carvey goes berserk, she doesn't attack the nearest living creature or object but instead moves adjacent to the creature nearest the balcony (or similar falling hazard, if the battle is taking place elsewhere) and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the creature over the cliff's edge.

The number of feet Carvey can Shove a creature is doubled as long as Carvey has 40 or fewer HP (thus, she pushes a creature 10 feet on a sucessful check and 20 feet on a critical success), but she must move the same distance and in the same direction as the pushed creature.

If the shoved creature falls over the cliff's edge, so does Carvey.

action->Berserk.name: Berserk
action->Berserk.description:
A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk.

If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

action->Electric Reflexes.name: Electric Reflexes
action->Electric Reflexes.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] an adjacent creature. The creature also takes @Damage[3d6[electricity]] damage on a success, or @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage on a critical success.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by fire (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[3d4[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] Hit Points); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

action->Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
action->Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.description: Casting a flesh to stone spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

action->Berserk Slam.name: Berserk Slam
action->Berserk Slam.description:
Requirement The flesh golem is berserk.

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d6 extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

weapon->+1 Striking Sap.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TLQErnOpM9Luy7rL]
+1 Striking Sap

action->Escort from the Premises.name: Escort from the Premises
action->Escort from the Premises.description:
Requirements The casino bouncer has Grabbed a Medium or smaller target and is wielding a nonlethal weapon in the other hand

Effect The casino bouncer makes a Strike against the grabbed target with the nonlethal weapon. If the Strike hits, it deals damage as usual and the casino bouncer moves the target 5 feet (this is forced movement) and Steps into the space the target had just occupied.

action->Intimidating Stare.name: Intimidating Stare
action->Intimidating Stare.description:
The casino bouncer attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize} a creature with a mere glance. The casino bouncer doesn't take a penalty to their Intimidation check if the target doesn't speak the same language.

If the bouncer rolls a critical success, the target can't reduce the value of its frightened condition until [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} have passed.

Chalky.name: Chalky
Chalky.publicNotes: This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

action->Alchemical Chambers.name: Alchemical Chambers
action->Alchemical Chambers.description:
An alchemical golem's body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following :

[[/br 1d6 #Alchemical Effect]] Alchemical Effect
1

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.T4ouD4mVFHA3EHs6]{Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)}
3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}
4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bQPRKEpnLakJBAAh]{Cat's Eye Elixir}
5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AqLxu3ir4UGzdOaz]{Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)}
6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TMtQnY6yvIRCpK9v]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Greater)}

action->Alchemical Rupture.name: Alchemical Rupture
action->Alchemical Rupture.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters - all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:5] are affected by the elixir in the randomly rolled alchemical chamber, and these creatures may forego their Reflex saves against the effect if they wish.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by sonic (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[2d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by acid (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] Hit Points); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

action->Vulnerable to Shatter.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
action->Vulnerable to Shatter.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell on an alchemical golem affects the golem normally, but also causes an alchemical rupture.

action->Alchemical Injection.name: Alchemical Injection
action->Alchemical Injection.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

Chalky's alchemical chambers are filled with helpful potions and elixirs rather than harmful substances. When Chalky targets an ally with its syringe Strike, the ally takes no damage and doesn't need to make a save against the rolled effect.

action->Adamantine Strikes.name: Adamantine Strikes
action->Adamantine Strikes.description: Chaos Gulgamodh's bodyincluding the appendages it uses to make melee Strikesis made of adamantine.

action->Cannon Fusillade.name: Cannon Fusillade
action->Cannon Fusillade.description:
Chaos Gulgamodh unleashes a salvo of explosive blasts in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(10d10+20)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save).

On a failed save, a creature is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave} effect. On a critically failed save, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Chaos Gulgamodh can't use Cannon Fusillade again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Cannon Fusillade]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Huge or smaller, foot, @Check[reflex|dc:43|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

action->Split.name: Split
action->Split.description: When a child of venom is hit by an attack that would deal slashing or piercing damage and the child of venom has at least 20 HP, the creature splits into two identical children of venom with half the original's HP. One child of venom is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, they automatically push creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The child of venom deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Suction.name: Suction
action->Suction.description: The child of venom can climb on ceilings and other inverted surfaces, though such surfaces are difficult terrain for them.

action->Efficient Winding.name: Efficient Winding
action->Efficient Winding.description:
For the clockwork amalgam to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 7 days, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.

The amalgam can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the amalgam down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the amalgam is in standby mode.

action->Recalibrate.name: Recalibrate
action->Recalibrate.description: The clockwork amalgam can recalibrate its internal structure to shed damaged components and replace them with new ones, restoring 125 HP to the construct. Each time it uses this ability, the clockwork amalgam permanently deactivates one of its five melee attacks as the components from that arm reassemble within the core of the machine.

action->Whirring Doom.name: Whirring Doom
action->Whirring Doom.description:
Frequency once per round

The clockwork amalgam becomes a blur of spinning weaponry. It makes up to five melee Strikes (one for each active melee attack it has available), taking a -4 penalty to the attack roll for each attack, but ignoring the multiple attack penalty until it has made all of its attacks. It can use each melee attack only once and it can target each creature in reach only once. If the clockwork amalgam used Whirring Doom in the previous round, it can use it again this round using only 1 action instead of 3. The amalgam's movement Speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

Clockwork Arms.name: Clockwork Arms
Clockwork Arms.description: Four claw-tipped clockwork arms suspended from the ceiling pick up and deposit creatures into a nearby hatch.
Clockwork Arms.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Deactivate One Arm|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam and deactivate one of the arms or @Check[athletics|dc:46|name:Tear Arm Off Machine] (legendary) to tear an arm off the machine.
Clockwork Arms.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per arm destroyed or disabled. On its turn, the trap makes claw Strikes against creatures other than the Rumormonger or the Inkmaster. If an arm already has a creature grabbed, the trap spends 2 actions to use its Open Hatch ability.

action->Arm Activation.name: Arm Activation
action->Arm Activation.description:
Trigger The Rumormonger or the Inkmaster enters the room

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Open Hatch.name: Open Hatch
action->Open Hatch.description: The metal hatch opens and the arms deposit a grabbed Medium or smaller creature into the hole. The creature becomes caught in the gears (see Caught in Gears) for 1 round before emerging in area K5. Reset Rewinding the gears for [[/br 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} resets the trap.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
action->Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:31|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

action->Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
action->Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
action->Unbalancing Blow.description: Creatures hit by the clockwork assassin's rapier hand Strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the clockwork assassin's next turn.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
action->Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

action->Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
action->Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

action->Whirlwind Strike.name: Whirlwind Strike
action->Whirlwind Strike.description: The chopper makes a melee Strike against each enemy within melee reach. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
action->Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

action->Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
action->Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

Clockwork Poison Bomb.disable: Three @Check[thievery|dc:31|name:Disable a Latch|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to disable the latches that lock the nozzle in place, then one @Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Turn Off Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) check to Disable a Device to turn off the nozzle; DCs decrease by 2 if Oggvurm is immobilized, paralyzed, unconscious, or dead

The cloud remains for 1 minute or until dispersed by strong winds.

Dart Barrage.description: Four dart-loaded pipes hidden in the diagonal walls are connected to a pressure plate under the brass seal in the room's center.
Dart Barrage.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable the pressure plate, or four @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Plug Dart Launcher|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) checks to plug the dart launchers
Dart Barrage.hpDetails: (BT 30) to destroy the seal and disable the trap

Dart Barrage.stealth: (trained) or @Check[perception|dc:23|traits:action:seek] (trained) to notice scratches around the musical pipes and a slight give to the seal

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -15-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, and the Escape DC is 19.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

consumable->Spellstrike Ammunition (Type.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NSo0bFX7DGGjqKKl]

Mystic patterns create a magic reservoir within this ammunition. You activate spellstrike ammunition by Casting a Spell into the ammunition. The spell must be of a spell rank the ammunition can hold, and the spell must be able to target a creature other than the caster. A creature hit by activated spellstrike ammunition is targeted by the spell. If the creature isn't a valid target for the spell, the spell is lost.

The ammunition affects only the target hit, even if the spell would normally affect more than one target. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, use the result of your ranged attack roll with the ammunition to determine the degree of success of the spell. If the spell requires a saving throw, the target attempts the save against your spell DC.

The maximum rank of spell the ammunition can hold determines its item level and Price.

action->Performance Anxiety.name: Performance Anxiety
action->Performance Anxiety.description:
A dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} if they see or hear a creature critically succeed at a Performance check or at a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

The dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for 1 round if they see or hear a creature critically fail at a Performance check or a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

They can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

action->Dreadsong.name: Dreadsong
action->Dreadsong.description:
The dreadsong dancer whirls their howling songblades and cloaks themself in illusion magic. Each non-fiend creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] from the dreadsong dancer must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success No effect, and the creature is temporarily immune for 24 hours. The dreadsong dancer is affected by their performance anxiety.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and the dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature for 1 minute. The creature can't use Seek to find the dreadsong dancer.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 2 for 1 minute. In addition, the dreadsong dancer is affected by its performance anxiety.

action->Arrogant Taunts.description:
The eberark utters crude insults and growls threateningly. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save.

The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

action->Incendiary Spit.name: Incendiary Spit
action->Incendiary Spit.description:
A creature hit by the eberark's spit becomes coated in a slippery, flammable oil.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they are coated in incendiary spit.

Creatures affected by incendiary spit that take fire damage catch fire, taking @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage. Once this persistent fire damage ends, the spit has burned away.

action->Trail of Flame.name: Trail of Flame
action->Trail of Flame.description:
The eberark Strides twice, leaving a trail of magical fire behind it as it moves. Squares the eberark moves through catch fire, creating a 5-foot-tall wall of flame that burns for 1 round. The wall of flame conceals creatures and objects on the other side of it.

Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the wall of flame takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).

action->Vein Walker.name: Vein Walker
action->Vein Walker.description: The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground. An excorion cannot be Tripped, Shoved, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).

action->Bloody Handprint.name: Bloody Handprint
action->Bloody Handprint.description: The excorion plants a magical handprint on the target, marking them as chosen for death. The excorion makes a fist Strike against an adjacent creature; this does not count toward the excorion's multiple attack penalty. On a hit, the attack does no damage, but the creature becomes observed to every excorion within 60 feet, even if an excorion's line of sight would be blocked by a wall or other obstacle. This effect lasts until the handprint is washed off, which requires water and spending 3 actions to fully clean off.

action->Vital Transfusion.name: Vital Transfusion
action->Vital Transfusion.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 70 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy; the living creature also counts as an excorion for 1 minute for the purpose of seeing other excorions' Bloody Handprint marks.

action->Vomit Blood.name: Vomit Blood
action->Vomit Blood.description: The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has grabbed. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

0.text: A creature critically hit by bloody spew is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

1.text: A creature hit by bloody spew is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Exploding Statue.description: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.
Exploding Statue.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire

action->Explosion.name: Explosion
action->Explosion.description:
Trigger A creature opens the northern door without first disabling the trip wire

Effect The statue explodes, spraying shrapnel to the west in a @Template[cone|distance:5] and dealing @Damage[(1d10+7)[piercing],1d10[fire]]{1d10+7 piercing and 1d10 fire} damage to all creatures in the affected area (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Explosive Barrels.name: Explosive Barrels
Explosive Barrels.description: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.
Explosive Barrels.disable: @Check[survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels

action->Explode.name: Explode
action->Explode.description:
Trigger 4 rounds pass after the agents' arrival without anyone smothering them

Effect The barrels explode, dealing @Damage[(3d6+8)[fire]] damage to everything within a 20-foot radius (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:fire] save).

Eyeball Tank.name: Eyeball Tank
Eyeball Tank.description: A vat of thick glass stands 10 feet high and is filled with green slime and fist-sized eyeballs.
Eyeball Tank.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:38|name:Acidify Slime|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) or @Check[crafting|dc:34|name:Acidify Slime] (expert) to acidify the slime inside the tank, destroying the eyeballs
Eyeball Tank.routine: (3 actions) Each round, the vat uses all three of its actions to shoot random eye rays at any living creatures (except Ixusoth) in range.

action->Eye-Opener.name: Eye-Opener
action->Eye-Opener.description:
Trigger Three or more living creatures remain within 20 feet of the trap for 1 round

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Spill Eyeballs.name: Spill Eyeballs
action->Spill Eyeballs.description:
Trigger The tank reaches its Broken Threshold

Effect The glass shatters, spilling eyeballs onto the floor in a 15-foot radius and casting grease(DC 33) on the affected area. The eyeball tank is permanently destroyed and can't be reset.Reset The trap can be reset by adding 100 new eyeballs to the tank and allowing them to grow in the slime for 1 week.

False Door Trap.name: False Door Trap
False Door Trap.description: A hidden needle delivers a magical poison to anyone trying to open the door.
False Door Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:32|name:Jam Needle in Housing|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam the needle in its housing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th level, counteract DC 30) to dispel the magical poison.

action->Purple Worm Sting.name: Purple Worm Sting

This bit of jade is usually carved in the shape of a duelist, or sometimes a multi-armed creature. When you activate the bauble, it magically draws the attention of foes. Until the start of your next turn, enemies within the reach of the weapon the talisman is affixed to are off-guard.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets Fayati with an attack and she can see the attacker

Effect Fayati dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
action->Opportune Backstab.description:
Trigger A creature within Fayati's reach is hit by a melee Strike from one of her allies

Effect Fayati makes a Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Deepen the Wound.name: Deepen the Wound
action->Deepen the Wound.description:
Requirements Fayati's last attack was a successful melee Strike with her rapier

Effect Fayati makes a main-gauche Strike against the same creature that she just hit. This Strike deals an additional 4d6 precision damage.

action->Guildmaster's Lead.name: Guildmaster's Lead
action->Guildmaster's Lead.description:
Whenever Fayati critically succeeds at a Strike against a creature, until the start of her next turn, the first time that another member of the Copper Hand deals damage to that creature during their turn, they deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to it.

Field Of Opposition.name: Field Of Opposition
Field Of Opposition.description: A distortion in space spawns an aggressive, malevolent shadow duplicate of any characters who pass between Terimor's faces.
Field Of Opposition.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to permanently disable the planar distortion (DC increases by 2 for each duplicate still extant), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; counteract DC 42) to destroy the planar distortion

action->Spawn Mirror Duplicate.name: Spawn Mirror Duplicate
action->Spawn Mirror Duplicate.description:
Trigger A creature moves between the two glass faces of Olansa Terimor

Effect The planar rift disgorges an evil mirror duplicate of the creature, and the duplicate rolls initiative.

The field of opposition can use this reaction once per round but can't spawn a duplicate of a creature that already has a mirror duplicate in existence.

action->Mirror Duplicate.name: Mirror Duplicate
action->Mirror Duplicate.description:
A mirror duplicate rolls initiative with a +45 modifier. It uses the same statistics as the original creature, but with a +2 status bonus to AC, attacks, and saving throws. The duplicate is evil, and any abilities reliant on alignment change accordingly. The duplicate is also aggressive, attacking and taking other hostile actions available to it against anyone other than mirror duplicates.

It has three actions and one reaction and can use any of the original creature's abilities. Any limited-use abilities (such as spell slots) are based on what the original had when duplicated and are used up separately from the original creature's. The duplicate also has duplicates of the creature's worn and held items, but not consumables.

A duplicate is destroyed when reduced to 0 HP, when the trap is disabled or destroyed, or when the duplicate leaves area E2. Its duplicated items disappear when they leave its grip, though they last long enough for ranged Strikes.

Flying Guillotine.name: Flying Guillotine
Flying Guillotine.description: An invisible magical glyph on the guillotine's blade detects living creatures in the room, which causes the guillotine to fly off its hinges and attack.
Flying Guillotine.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Erase Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the glyph (which requires a successful unarmed attack roll if the blade is already active) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract it. The trap has a secret bypass known only to Ralso and Pratchett: as long as the guillotine can see a creature in the room touching thumb and pinky together with an empty hand, it remains dormant.
Flying Guillotine.reset: After 1 minute, the trap deactivates, though the door remains locked. The trap rearms itself each day at dawn.
Flying Guillotine.routine: (1 action) The blade @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to 20 feet and Strikes any creatures whose squares it passes through. It cannot target the same creature more than once per round. The blade cannot be grappled and doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

action->Flying Blade.name: Flying Blade
action->Flying Blade.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the room

Effect One round after a creature enters the room, the door to the room slams shut and locks (two Thievery checks to pick), and the guillotine blade detaches from its housing and begins flying around the room as the trap rolls initiative.

To anchor a grappling hook, make an attack roll with the secret trait against a DC depending on the target, typically at least DC 20. On a success, your hook has a firm hold, but on a critical failure, the hook seems like it will hold but actually falls when you're partway up.

You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

action->Deflective Dodge.name: Deflective Dodge
action->Deflective Dodge.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Franca fails or critically fails

Effect Franca can choose to either Step or redirect the attack to a creature that is adjacent to her and within the reach of the triggering attack.

The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

action->Bloody Rebel.name: Bloody Rebel
action->Bloody Rebel.description:
Franca quickly slashes at nearby foes, aiming to maim rather than disable. She makes up to three melee Strikes, each against a different creature within reach.

These Strikes count toward Franca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all three Strikes are made.

On a hit, the Strike deals @Damage[3[bleed]] damage instead of its normal damage.

On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Franca's next turn or until they spend an action to remove the condition, whichever comes first.

action->Hamstring.name: Hamstring
action->Hamstring.description:
Requirements Franca's last action was a melee Strike that dealt sneak attack damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target

Effect Franca deals @Damage[6[bleed]] damage to the target creature, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Franca's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Splash Poison.name: Splash Poison
action->Splash Poison.description:
Franca uncorks and flings a dose of poison at a bleeding foe.

She retrieves a poison from her inventory, then splashes it at a creature within 10 feet that is currently taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:32] save or be exposed to the poison.

Freezing Alarm.name: Freezing Alarm
Freezing Alarm.description: Miniature snowflake-shaped glyphs on the ground cause a layer of ice to ripple over the floor of the room and sound a silent alarm.
Freezing Alarm.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:53|name:Disable Arcana] (legendary) to draw a fiery counteracting glyph over each snowflake, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level, counteract DC 48)

action->Freeze Floor.name: Freeze Floor
action->Freeze Floor.description:
Trigger A creature enters one of the three squares marked with a T on the map

Effect The floor of the entire 10-foot-by-15-foot antechamber freezes over, sending deadly magical frost creeping up the legs of the intruders. Any creatures standing in the room must roll a @Check[reflex|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(3d10+5)[cold]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(6d10+10)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(12d10+20)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Additionally, the golems in area B10 become aware of the intruders. The golems activate and come to this room to attack, if they haven't been destroyed already.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
When Frefferth is destroyed, his body and items dissipate into shadowy nothingness and the knight re-forms after [[/br 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days} within the sarcophagus in area D12, fully healed.

Frefferth can be trapped only by returning the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6MIBHKMJmD8uQVam]{Chain of the Stilled Spirit} to the sarcophagus (see areas D12 and D34), in which case Frefferth's body dissipates, leaving his items in the spot where he was last slain.

action->Head Hunter.name: Head Hunter
action->Head Hunter.description:
Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.hg3IogR8ue2IWwgS]{Keen}, and any hatchet it wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]{Returning}.

If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target.

These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.

action->Impaler.name: Impaler
action->Impaler.description:
Whenever Frefferth damages a creature with a critical hit using a ranged piercing weapon, the weapon remains impaled in the victim's body.

The victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} as long as they are impaled; the impaling weapon can be removed by the affected creature or an adjacent ally as a 2-action activity that has the manipulate trait.

action->Reap.name: Reap
action->Reap.description:
Frefferth removes the head of a dead creature within reach.

Each creature within the area of Frefferth's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.

action->Summon Steed.name: Summon Steed
action->Summon Steed.description:
Frefferth summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qRUqoezeEnQ2KdyT]{Nightmare}.

This steed remains until it is slain, Frefferth @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismisses} it, or Frefferth summons another steed.

action->Charming Liar.name: Charming Liar
action->Charming Liar.description:
When Gage gets a critical success using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} action, the target's attitude toward him improves by one step, as though he'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

This works only once per conversation, and if he critically succeeds against multiple targets using the same result, he chooses one creature's attitude to improve.

To use this ability, Gage must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate his status, or ingratiate himself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.

action->Smooth Operator.name: Smooth Operator
action->Smooth Operator.description:
When Gage meets a group of up to five people, he can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, comparing the result to the Will DC of each target.

He takes a -3 penalty on this check, and it is possible to get different degrees of success for each target. If he fails or critically fails, he can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.

action->Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
action->Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

action->Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
action->Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

weapon->+2 Striking Crossbow.name: +2 Striking Crossbow
weapon->+2 Striking Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.name: +2 Striking Dagger
weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Sidestep.name: Sidestep
action->Sidestep.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting the assassin fails or critically fails

Effect The assassin deftly steps out of the way of the attack. If there's another creature adjacent to the assassin and within reach of the triggering attack, the assassin redirects the attack to that adjacent creature. The attacker then rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

action->Point Blank.name: Point Blank
action->Point Blank.description: The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against an adjacent enemy; unlike most ranged Strikes, this Strike doesn't provoke reactions. If successful, the attack deals an additional 4d8 precision damage.

action->Running Reload.name: Running Reload
action->Running Reload.description: The master assassin Strides, Steps, or Sneaks, then Interacts to reload her crossbow.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The master assassin deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Study Target.name: Study Target
action->Study Target.description: The master assassin observes a single target she can see, allowing her to use her Vorpal Garrote during the next round.

action->Vorpal Garrote.name: Vorpal Garrote
action->Vorpal Garrote.description:
Requirements The master assassin used Study Target during the previous round and must have a garrote bolt

Effect The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against the target she previously studied. If she rolls a success on her attack roll, she gets a critical success instead. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect.

Failure The target takes an additional 3d12 precision damage.

Critical Failure The target is decapitated and instantly dies unless it doesn't require a head to live.

Gas Trap.name: Gas Trap
Gas Trap.description: A spring slams and locks the room's door before four hidden gas vents begin pumping poison gas into the chamber.
Gas Trap.disable: Four @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Block Gas Vents|traits:action:disable-a-device] checks to block the gas vents, or a @Check[thievery|dc:26|name:Unlock Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] check to unlock the door and escape
Gas Trap.reset: The trap must be manually rearmed by unblocking the vents or replacing the poison gas tank in area E30.
Gas Trap.routine:
(1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more toxic gas into the room.

Any breathing creature in the room takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (a successful @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison,damaging-effect] save halves the damage taken). If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone taking damage from the trap-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. Locating and blocking one of the hidden gas vents reduces the poison damage by 1d6-if all four are blocked, the trap is disabled, though the door remains locked. Otherwise, the trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended and characters in the room cease taking damage, after which the trap ventilates the room for 1 additional minute.
Gas Trap.stealth: (trained) to smell the poison gas or hear it hissing

action->Toxic Gas.name: Toxic Gas
action->Toxic Gas.description:
Trigger A creature opens one of the drawers

Effect The door to the room slams shut and locks and the trap rolls initiative. (The trap can also be triggered manually or disarmed from area E30.)

action->Free Blade.name: Free Blade
action->Free Blade.description:
Trigger The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.

Effect A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay.

The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword Strike, gives it a penalty to its greatsword Strike, or prevents it from acting.

The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.

action->Light Form.name: Light Form
action->Light Form.description:
A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness).

It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.

action->Choose Weakness.name: Choose Weakness
action->Choose Weakness.description:
A ghaele attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about a foe they are facing.

If successful, they can change the elemental damage dealt by their greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the foe's weakness.

They can also change their energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for their attacks).

The choices remain until they next use Choose Weakness.

action->Ghaele's Gaze.name: Ghaele's Gaze
action->Ghaele's Gaze.description:
When a ghaele fixes their gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature is subjected to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} (@Check[will|dc:20|name:Divine Decree|traits:damaging-effect] save).

If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

action->Greater Holy Blade.name: Greater Holy Blade
action->Greater Holy Blade.description: Any weapon becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rvItjGQaYT7Luwtm]{+3} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]{Holy} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} weapon while the ghaele wields it.

action->Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
action->Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A giant bone skipper identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

action->Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
action->Leaping Charge.description: The giant bone skipper @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 20 feet. It then makes a mandibles Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

action->Marrow Rot.name: Marrow Rot
action->Marrow Rot.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25|traits:disease]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

action->Web Trap.name: Web Trap
action->Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the joro spider's web Strike is immobilized and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 25).

action->Hypnotic Glow.name: Hypnotic Glow
action->Hypnotic Glow.description: 30 feet. Similar to other will-o'-wisps, a gloaming will-o'-wisp is naturally invisible, but glows with a faint colored light. They cast dim light in the aura, which makes them visible. In addition, any non-aberration creature that ends their turn in the aura and can see the gloaming will-o'-wisp is distracted by the gloaming will-o'-wisp's glow and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
action->Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except faerie fire, glitterdust, magic missile, and maze.

action->Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or dying within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp

Effect The will-o'-wisp feeds on the creature's terror. They regains 4d8 Hit Points, and if they've Gone Dark, their glow reignites. A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.

action->Go Dark.name: Go Dark
action->Go Dark.description: The gloaming will-o'-wisp extinguishes their hypnotic glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. They can end this effect with another use of this action. If they use their shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine their location, making the will-o'-wisp only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to observers until they move.

Effect Grabble can cast one prepared spell he has already cast today without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements. He can do this once per day for each of the spell ranks he can cast.

action->Poison Conversion.name: Poison Conversion
action->Poison Conversion.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect If Grabble's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th rank or lower and deals acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage, the spell deals poison damage rather than its normal damage type and gains the poison trait.

action->Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
action->Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

action->Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
action->Sea Hag's Bargain.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.

action->Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
action->Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 37). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

action->Pull Under.name: Pull Under
action->Pull Under.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]] days-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

action->Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
action->Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a +27 counteract modifier.

action->Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
action->Devastating Blast.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of energy.

Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save).

The graveknight can't use this ability again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
action->Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:43|traits:curse] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

action->Kharnas's Blessing.name: Kharnas's Blessing
action->Kharnas's Blessing.description:
The graveknight carves the sigil of Kharnas onto an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature.

As long as the creature bears the sigil of Kharnas, it takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against the abilities of any creature that previously served Kharnas, but it can also freely pass through any hazards that can be bypassed by those bearing the sigil of Kharnas, such as Kharnas's glyphs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.St2QzqQvKN0IaXxG]{Effect: Kharna's Blessing}

action->Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
action->Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
Greater Planar Rift.description: A ragged planar rift drags things into its depths and hurls creatures through from its terminal end.
Greater Planar Rift.disable: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 46) to seal the rift

action->Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
action->Greater Planar Rift.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 5 feet of the rift

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44] save or be drawn into the rift. A creature so drawn in becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} and immediately teleports to a different random area in Kharnas's ruins.

consumable->Snake Oil.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.xBZCVHAa1SnR8Xul]

Activate A Interact

You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn't feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a @Check[perception|dc:17|traits:action:seek] check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil's effects.

consumable->Tindertwig.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ylUdMTsfOQGJ3MN3]
Tindertwig
consumable->Tindertwig.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ylUdMTsfOQGJ3MN3]

Activate A Interact

An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

action->Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
action->Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

action->Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
action->Katar Specialist.description: Gref has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

action->Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
action->Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Gref stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

action->Swarming.name: Swarming
action->Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

action->Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
action->Unbalancing Blow.description: Any creature a grick critically hits is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against its attacks until the end of the grick's next turn.

action->Vermicular Movement.name: Vermicular Movement
action->Vermicular Movement.description: When a grick takes a Stride action to move half its Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking Longsword.name: +2 Greater Striking Longsword
weapon->+2 Greater Striking Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Disguise Kit (Elite).name: Disguise Kit (Elite)
equipment->Disguise Kit (Elite).description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Dueling Parry.name: Dueling Parry
action->Dueling Parry.description: As long as he has one free hand, Grimwold can parry attacks against him with his longsword. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn as long as his other hand remains free.

action->Studied Strike.name: Studied Strike
action->Studied Strike.description: Grimwold studies his foe for weaknesses to exploit. His next successful Strike against that target deals an additional 4d6 precision damage.

weapon->Lawkeeper (+1 Striking Pacifying.name:
