armor->Breastplate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.r0ifJfoz8aqf0mwk]

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.e0vSAQfxhHauiAoD]

A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Furious Pacifier.name: Furious Pacifier
action->Furious Pacifier.description: Lavarsus adds double his Strength modifier to any nonlethal melee Strikes he makes with a bludgeoning weapon.

action->Nonlethal Training.name: Nonlethal Training
action->Nonlethal Training.description:
Lavarsus has trained to take down suspects without killing them.

He can choose to make nonlethal attacks with any bludgeoning weapon without taking the usual penalty to his attack roll.

Grunka.name: Grunka
Grunka.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.yd3kEK21YknZLlcT]

Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Grunka.

Effect Grunka @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Hands Of The Forgotten.name: Hands Of The Forgotten
Hands Of The Forgotten.description: Ethereal hands stretch out from the walls and floor, attempting to restrain nearby creatures.
Hands Of The Forgotten.disable: @Check[religion|dc:30|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[intimidation|dc:32|name:Scare Away the Hands|traits:action:demoralize] (expert) to scare away the hands

action->Waylay.name: Waylay
action->Waylay.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the area marked on the map

Effect Misty blue hands stretch out from the hallway's stone tiles and grasp at the triggering creature, which must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] save to avoid becoming hindered or harmed by the ethereal hands.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[void]] damage.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[(4d10+15)[void]] damage.

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.description:
A hegessik can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the hegessik the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The hegessik's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->Maddening Whispers.name: Maddening Whispers
action->Maddening Whispers.description:
30 feet. A susurrus of distracting whispers and dilations in reality surround a hegessik.

When a non-protean ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

action->Protean Anatomy 20.name: Protean Anatomy 20
action->Protean Anatomy 20.description:
A hegessik's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The hegessik is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the hegessik automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

The hegessik takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Leaching Glare.name: Leaching Glare
action->Leaching Glare.description:
The hegessik briefly opens its third eye.

Non-protean creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).

action->Telekinetic Reach.name: Telekinetic Reach
action->Telekinetic Reach.description:
The hegessik manifests psychic versions of its natural attacks and makes a Strike with each of its jaws, claw, and tail, in any order. These Strikes have a reach of 60 feet.

equipment->Corpseward Pendant.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8YnlhfZSQ89FjDZ2]

This small pendant is usually shaped like a humanoid skull or small animal skull.

Activate 3 Interact

Frequency three times per day

Effect You become undetectable to undead creatures for 10 minutes. Undead can't see, hear, or smell you, nor detect you with sensory capabilities such as scent or tremorsense. A creature can attempt a single DC 18 Will saving throw to ignore this effect. If an undead has reason to believe that undetected opponents are present, it can still attempt to Seek or Strike you. If you attempt to use a vitality spell to damage undead, use Command Undead, touch or damage an undead creature, or attack any creature while warded in this manner, the pendant's effects immediately end. An undead creature who observes you in this manner or one who succeeds at the Will save is immune to the corpseward pendant for 24 hours.

Hestriviniaas can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

action->Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
action->Protean Anatomy.description:
Hestriviniaas' vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Hestriviniaas takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type.

This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The keketar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target.

If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the keketar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

action->Spatial Riptide.name: Spatial Riptide
action->Spatial Riptide.description:
30 feet. A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save or wink out of existence for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Keketars are immune to this effect.

action->Change Shape.description:

action->Reshape Reality.description: When Hestriviniaas casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

The creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls or Grab an Edge is 22.

action->Entropic Feedback.name: Entropic Feedback
action->Entropic Feedback.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to target the hundun with a mental effect

Effect The triggering creature is subject to the utter chaos of the hundun's mind and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

action->Activate Attractor.name: Activate Attractor
action->Activate Attractor.description:
The hundun releases its staff-like attractor, which hovers in place. The hundun can use an action, which has the concentrate trait, to move the attractor up to 60 feet, to a maximum of 300 feet from the hundun. It can also use an action, which has the concentrate trait, to recall the attractor, which flies to the hundun and immediately deactivates.

Creatures within 40 feet of the attractor must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40|name:Attractor] save if they're within the area when the attractor is activated or as soon as they enter the area while it's active. Once a creature has attempted the save, it uses the same result for the rest of that activation of the attractor.

Any restrictions on a creature's movement apply only if it voluntarily moves away from the attractor. For example, if the attractor moves closer to a creature, the creature doesn't then need to move away.

Chaotic creatures are immune to the effects of the attractor.

The attractor can't be harmed by physical attacks but is destroyed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.HuGZspUvJqR09Y8u]{Rod of Cancellation}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.B4DnQNcGl6nFVKHl]{Sphere of Annihilation}, and other similarly powerful effects.

The attractor has an AC of 40 and a counteract DC of 37. A hundun can rebuild a destroyed attractor after [[/br 1d8 #hours]]{1d8 hours} of uninterrupted meditation. If the hundun is slain, its attractor disappears.

Critical Success The creature's movement isn't restricted.

Success The creature treats each square in the area as difficult terrain when moving away from the attractor.

Failure The creature can't move away from the attractor within the area.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description: The hundun makes two Strikes with its fist. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The Il'setya's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->Protean Anatomy 10.description:
Il'setya's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after Il'setya takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, she gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time she takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

Il'setya is immune to polymorph effects unless she is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, Il'setya automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

action->Dimensional Slide.name: Dimensional Slide
action->Dimensional Slide.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect Il'setsya steps through a transient hole in space, instantly teleporting to a space within 60 feet that she can see.

action->Prehensile Tail.name: Prehensile Tail
action->Prehensile Tail.description: Il'setsya's prehensile tail can hold and manipulate objects of Light Bulk or less, though it cannot be used to attack. She can spend an Interact action to use her tail to fetch objects stowed on her person, such as potions.

action->Warpwave Spell.name: Warpwave Spell
action->Warpwave Spell.description:
Il'setsya infuses her next spell with roiling currents of chaos.

If Il'setsya Casts a Spell before her turn is over and the spell affects a creature, that creature is also subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

If she doesn't Cast a Spell before the beginning of her next turn, this action is wasted.

Ink Drowning Vats.name: Ink Drowning Vats
Ink Drowning Vats.description: Steel hatch doors automatically lock shut in each of the four vats labeled J2. Four ink spouts (one per vat) jut through a narrow aperture in the ceiling of each vat, 20 feet above.
Ink Drowning Vats.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Seal an Ink Spout|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to seal an ink spout, @Check[thievery|dc:48|name:Unlock a Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] (master) to unlock a steel hatch door, or @Check[athletics|dc:45|name:Force Open a Door|traits:action:force-open] (master) to Force Open a steel hatch door
Ink Drowning Vats.reset: The trap can be reset by refilling the ink storage tanks above the vats.
Ink Drowning Vats.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled ink spout. On each of the trap's actions, a spout pours ink, increasing the depth of the ink in that vat by 2 feet. Creatures standing in the ink are exposed to a dose of poison ink. Once the vat is full of ink, the trap stops using actions, but creatures in the vat might start drowning.

action->Fill Tank.name: Fill Tank
action->Fill Tank.description:
Trigger The switch outside the vats is pulled

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
action->Poison Ink.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 3d6 poison damage and sickened 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison damage and sickened 2 (1 round)

Inky Tendrils.name: Inky Tendrils
Inky Tendrils.description: Six giant tentacles reach up from the ink lake, grabbing any foes in reach and dragging them underwater.
Inky Tendrils.disable:
@Check[athletics|dc:48|name:Disable Athletics] (legendary) or @Check[athletics|dc:45|name:Disable Acrobatics]{Acrobatics} (master) to tie one tentacle into a knot, rendering it useless, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 44) to counteract one tentacle.

The death of the Daemonic Rumormonger permanently dispels all the inky tendrils.
Inky Tendrils.routine: (6 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for every tentacle that is disabled or destroyed. The tentacles can combine their actions to use the hazard's Inky Imitator ability. A broken tentacle can still Strike, but it can't Grab. This hazard takes no multiple attack penalty.

action->Black Ink Delirium.name: Black Ink Delirium
action->Black Ink Delirium.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

action->Inky Imitator.name: Inky Imitator
action->Inky Imitator.description:
The inky tendrils cast a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.73rToy0v5Ra9NvL6]{Duplicate Foe} spell (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|name:Duplicate Foe]) on the target; on a failed save, a simulacrum of the target made from dripping ink and clockwork scraps emerges from any other spot (tendrils' choice) in the lake.

The tendrils don't need to Sustain the Spell; the duplicate exists for 1 minute or until it is destroyed before collapsing into a puddle of ink and scrap metal.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(2d8+10)[bludgeoning]] plus black ink delirium, @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Tendrils Come Alive.name: Tendrils Come Alive
action->Tendrils Come Alive.description:
Trigger A non-daemonic creature moves within 15 feet of the shoreline

Effect The hazard makes a tentacle Strike against the triggering creature and the hazard rolls initiative.

Iron Maiden Trap.name: Iron Maiden Trap
Iron Maiden Trap.description: A pressure plate hidden on the floor before an iron maiden causes the torture device to snap shut and trap the triggering creature inside.
Iron Maiden Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to disable the pressure plate
Iron Maiden Trap.reset: The pressure plate must be reset manually.

action->Slam Shut.name: Slam Shut
action->Slam Shut.description:
Trigger A creature steps onto the trap's pressure plate (indicated on the map)

Effect The front of the iron maiden slams shut with incredible force and locks itself. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(4d10+10)[piercing]] damage and @Damage[2d6[bleed]] (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save; if the creature critically succeeds, they avoid the trap completely). The triggering creature is also immobilized. The victim can end their immobilization only once a creature outside the iron maiden unlocks the device (requiring two successful @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Unlock Iron Maiden|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] checks to Disable a Device) or breaks the iron maiden, after which the trapped creature must succeed at a DC 25 check to Escape the trap's spike-lined interior.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger The Iroran skeleton is critically hit

Effect The Iroran skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals damage for a hit, rather than a critical hit.

The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

action->Flurry of Claws.name: Flurry of Claws
action->Flurry of Claws.description:
The Iroran skeleton makes two claw Strikes. If both hit the same creature, the damage is combined for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The multiple attack penalty applies to the Strikes as normal.

action->Wall Run.name: Wall Run
action->Wall Run.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride along vertical surfaces, such as walls, as long as it begins and ends its movement on a horizontal surface.

action->Water Step.name: Water Step
action->Water Step.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride across liquid surfaces. If it ends its movement on a liquid surface, it falls in as normal.

action->Whirlwind Kick.name: Whirlwind Kick
action->Whirlwind Kick.description: The Iroran skeleton makes a single Strike and compares the result to the AC of all creatures within its reach, dealing damage to each creature hit.

Ixusoth.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment->Robe of Eyes.name: Robe of Eyes
equipment->Robe of Eyes.description:
This garment appears to be an ordinary robe until donned, at which point numerous strange and alien eyes of varied shapes and colors open and blink across its fabric. While wearing the robe, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, and you constantly benefit from the effects of a 2nd-rank see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell.

You can also see powerful magic auras. The highest-level magic aura within 30 feet of you glows in a color that reveals its school to you and allows you to determine where the effect originates. This can narrow down the origin point of the effect to a 5-foot-cube, but not more precisely than that.

The robe of eyes is not without its dangers. If any spell with the light trait is cast on you or your square while you are wearing the robe, you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's rank unless you succeed at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.

Activate A Interact

Effect You pluck an eye from the robe and toss it into the air, where it turns invisible and floats to a destination you choose, with the same effect as a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Scouting Eye} spell. You can Sustain the Activation just as you would be able to Sustain the Spell.

action->Lore Master.name: Lore Master
action->Lore Master.description: Ixusoth retains a vast amount of knowledge. She can use her Bardic Lore skill to Recall Knowledge on any topic, and she knows any languages common to an area she has spent a day or more in.

action->Eye Probe.name: Eye Probe
action->Eye Probe.description:
Frequency once per day

Up to six of Ixusoth's eyes detach from her body. Each eye has AC 26, HP 1, and a fly speed of 40 feet. Ixusoth can see through all of her eye probes. She can move the probes all in separate directions using a single action. Ixusoth can have no more than six eye probes active at a time; using this ability to create more eyes causes the eye or eyes farthest away to shrivel and die.

Ixusoth can deliver touch spells through her eye probes and make melee spell attacks through them. In addition, she can Steal Memories through an eye probe using a single action by touching the target with the eye.

action->Scatterbrain Palm.name: Scatterbrain Palm
action->Scatterbrain Palm.description:
A creature hit by Ixusoth's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save. The creature is then temporarily immune until the start of its next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is stunned 1.

Failure The creature is stunned 2.

Critical Failure The creature is stunned 3, and the hyakume can use Steal Memories on the target as part of this action.

action->Steal Memories.name: Steal Memories
action->Steal Memories.description: Ixusoth reaches out with her mind and attempts to steal memories from a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] saving throw or become stupefied 2 and have some of its memories stolen. When Ixusoth steals memories, she learns some of the creature's memories (chosen by the GM). These memories are then lost to that creature.

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 fe.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 fe.description:
A Izfiitar can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the izflitar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The izflitar's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Fast Healing 20.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]
Fast Healing 20

action->Kiss of the Speakers.name: Kiss of the Speakers
action->Kiss of the Speakers.description:
The izfiitar continuously tinkers with the myriad possibilities in which it can move or manipulate magic.

The izfiitar is always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action only to Cast a Spell, Step, or Stride.

action->Prescient Revision.name: Prescient Revision
action->Prescient Revision.description:
Trigger The izfiitar fails a check

Effect The izfiitar rerolls the triggering check and takes the better result.

For [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, it loses the effects of Kiss of the Speakers and can't use Reshape Reality.

action->Protean Anatomy 25.name: Protean Anatomy 25
action->Protean Anatomy 25.description:
A izfiitar's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the izfiitar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The izfiitar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the izfiitar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

The izfiitar takes the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Greater Warpwave Strike.name: Greater Warpwave Strike
action->Greater Warpwave Strike.description:
Any creature struck and damaged by an izfiitar's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or be subject to a particularly powerful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

Roll twice and apply both affects, rerolling any duplicates.

action->Reshape Reality.name: Reshape Reality
action->Reshape Reality.description: When the izfiitar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

action->Storm of Claws.name: Storm of Claws
action->Storm of Claws.description: The izfiitar makes up to six claw Strikes, each against a different target.

Jonis Flakfatter.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. disease and poison

spell->Purify Food and Drink.target: 1 cubic foot of contaminated food or water

weapon->+1 Spell Storing Dagger (contain.name: +1 Spell Storing Dagger (contains crisis of faith)
weapon->+1 Spell Storing Dagger (contain.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Norgorber).name: Religious Symbol (Norgorber)
equipment->Religious Symbol (Norgorber).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Call Toxins.name: Call Toxins
action->Call Toxins.description: 30 feet. Flakfatter exudes an aura that makes poisons more potent. His melee Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d8[persistent,poison]]. Creatures in the aura attempting a flat check to remove persistent poison damage must roll twice and take the lower result. Flakfatter can suppress or resume this aura as a free action.

action->Infector.name: Infector
action->Infector.description: Flakfatter targets a creature within 30 feet that's currently subject to a poison affliction. The poison affliction progresses to the next stage.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Flakfatter's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Mage Armor

weapon->+2 Striking Staff.name: +2 Striking Staff
weapon->+2 Striking Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

equipment->Bracers of Armor II.name: Bracers of Armor II
equipment->Bracers of Armor II.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

equipment->Disguise Kit (Elite).name: Disguise Kit (Elite)
equipment->Disguise Kit (Elite).description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

consumable->Healing Potion (Moderate).name: Healing Potion (Moderate)
consumable->Healing Potion (Moderate).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(3d8+10)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Contingency Plan.name: Contingency Plan
action->Contingency Plan.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Kapral is targeted by an attack

Effect Kapral casts blink on herself.

consumable->Snake Oil.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.xBZCVHAa1SnR8Xul]

Activate A Interact

You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn't feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a @Check[perception|dc:17|traits:action:seek] check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil's effects.

consumable->Tindertwig.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ylUdMTsfOQGJ3MN3]
Tindertwig
consumable->Tindertwig.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ylUdMTsfOQGJ3MN3]

Activate A Interact

An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

action->Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
action->Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

action->Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
action->Katar Specialist.description: Kekker has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

action->Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
action->Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Kekker stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

action->Swarming.name: Swarming
action->Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y6rAdMK6EFlV6U0t]

effect->Spell Effect: Mage Armor.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.qkwb5DD3zmKwvbk0]
Spell Effect: Mage Armor
effect->Spell Effect: Mage Armor.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.qkwb5DD3zmKwvbk0]

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mage armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

action->Eschew Materials.name: Eschew Materials
action->Eschew Materials.description:
You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air.

Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.

Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.name: Kharnas's Lesser Glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.description: A hidden glyph suddenly lights up and dominates the mind of any creature not bearing the sigil of Kharnas the Angel-Binder.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.disable: Disable @Check[thievery|dc:46|name:Destroy Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to destroy the glyph, @Check[arcana|dc:42|name:Divert Glyph's Power] (master) to harmlessly divert the glyph's power, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.reset: The glyph can affect two creatures before it deactivates for 5 minutes and automatically resets.

action->Dominate.name: Dominate
action->Dominate.description:
Trigger A creature who doesn't bear the sigil of Kharnas attempts to open the door

Effect A surge of the Radiant Spark's latent power courses through the glyph and washes over the triggering creature. If the creature is undead, it takes @Damage[10d10[vitality]] damage. If it's living, it instead regains @Damage[10d10[healing]] Hit Points. It then must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:incapacitation,mental] save or be affected by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} spell.

The spell commands the affected creature to attack the nearest creature who doesn't bear the sigil of Kharnas.

equipment->Standard Skeleton Key.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fprUZviW8khm2BLo]
Standard Skeleton Key
equipment->Standard Skeleton Key.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fprUZviW8khm2BLo]

A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves' tools when attempting to Pick a Lock, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.

If the skeleton key becomes broken due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves' tools and loses its benefits until repaired.

Activate F Interact

Frequency once per day

Trigger You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven't rolled yet

Effect The key casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6Ot4N22t5tPD51BO]{Knock} on the lock you're trying to pick.

action->Scurry.name: Scurry
action->Scurry.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Kolo

Effect Kolo Steps.

action->Upward Stab.name: Upward Stab
action->Upward Stab.description: Kolo's melee Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to Medium or larger creatures.

Lie-Master.name: Lie-Master
Lie-Master.publicNotes:
Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayal-although the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to "life" as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortal's needs.

These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.
Lie-Master.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

spell->True Seeing.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]
True Seeing

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Dimension Door

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
Tongues

spell->Abyssal Pact.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tsKnoBuBbKMXkiz5]
Abyssal Pact

consumable->Black Dragon's Breath Potion.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LR7Ke2V8vHjQYBni]

This liquid contains blood from a black dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a black dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[line|distance:30] of acid which deals @Damage[10d6[acid]] damage. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|name:Wyrm Black Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Truth Vulnerability.name: Truth Vulnerability
action->Truth Vulnerability.description: A glabrezu's lies sustain them, and the truth can destroy them. Whenever a revelation effect counteracts or reveals the glabrezu's illusions or the glabrezu fails a save against an effect that would prevent them from lying (such as zone of truth), the demon takes @Damage[(3d6+4)[mental]] damage. They take this damage only once per effect, even if the effect reveals multiple illusions or prevents multiple lies.

action->Captive Rake.name: Captive Rake
action->Captive Rake.description:
Requirements A creature is grabbed in the glabrezu's pincer.

Effect The glabrezu pulls the grabbed creature up to 5 feet closer, then makes two claw Strikes against it. Those Strikes count as one attack when determining a treachery demon's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both Strikes.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: When a reaction would disrupt a glabrezu's spell, the demon can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:17] check, avoiding the disruption on a success.

action->Sudden Betrayal.name: Sudden Betrayal
action->Sudden Betrayal.description: A glabrezu can always use Deception when rolling initiative as long as they're aware of at least one opponent before initiative is rolled. When using Deception for initiative, the demon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception.

action->Tentacle Trip.name: Tentacle Trip
action->Tentacle Trip.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet of the lie-master uses a manipulate or move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:34] save or be knocked prone by the lie-master's clockwork tentacles.

action->Treacherous Veil.name: Treacherous Veil
action->Treacherous Veil.description: A glabrezu's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} can allow it to appear as a creature of any size.

action->Twisted Desires.name: Twisted Desires
action->Twisted Desires.description: Once per month, a glabrezu can grant a mortal humanoid the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} spell granted by an Abyssal patron, though the glabrezu always perverts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} according to their own treacherous nature.

action->Grab.name: Grab
action->Grab.description:
Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is grabbed by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the Escape action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.

Life Magnet.name: Life Magnet
Life Magnet.description: A magical magnet hidden behind a panel in the corner of the room pulls not metal but living creatures toward it, heedless of any obstacles in the way.
Life Magnet.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Deactivate Panel|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the panel, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic};(4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract the panel's magic
Life Magnet.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no creatures touching the iron bars.
Life Magnet.routine:
(1 action) The trap pulls up to four creatures that have already triggered its Magnetize the Living ability toward one of the far corners of the room, possibly pressing them into the iron bars. If all the iron bars between an affected creature and the magnetic panel remain intact, the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:25]{DC 25 basic Fortitude} save and is restrained on a failure (Escape DC 23).

If an iron bar has been broken, the creature takes @Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage instead, and if two consecutive bars have been broken the creature takes no damage (but might still be restrained on a failed save).

action->Magnetize the Living.name: Magnetize the Living
action->Magnetize the Living.description:
Trigger A creature touches any of the iron bars in this area or touches a creature already affected by the trap

Effect The magical panel hidden in the far corner of the chamber (either the western or the eastern corner, depending on which side of the room the creature was closest to when it triggered the trap) "magnetizes" the triggering creature and violently pulls it toward the corner, automatically dealing @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage to the creature.

The trap then rolls initiative if it hasn't already done so.

action->Backdrop.name: Backdrop
action->Backdrop.description: When a creature attempts to Strike a living mural and critically misses, the attacker hits the surface (a wall, canvas, or so on) behind the living mural. This can damage or break the weapon or surface.

action->Surface-Bound.name: Surface-Bound
action->Surface-Bound.description:
A living mural can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a fireball spell or a puddle being splashed), the mural takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the living mural is destroyed.

action->Collective Attack.name: Collective Attack
action->Collective Attack.description:
The subjects depicted within the living mural all reach out at once to attack. The living mural makes a fist Strike against each target within range.

These attacks count toward the living mural's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of the attacks are made.

action->Paint the Masses.name: Paint the Masses
action->Paint the Masses.description:
The living mural expels a @Template[cone|distance:15] of paint.

Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

The living mural can't use Paint the Masses again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Paint the Masses]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Splash of Color.name: Splash of Color
action->Splash of Color.description: When the living mural hits with a splatter attack, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Living Paints.name: Living Paints
Living Paints.description: A mass of brushes use magical paint to convert creatures into art.
Living Paints.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:41|name:Crafting Disable] (master) to mix the paints into bland, useless colors, @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Thievery Disable] (legendary) to dismantle the animated brushes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 41) to counteract the magic within the paint.

action->Capture Subject.name: Capture Subject
action->Capture Subject.description:
Trigger A creature steps into the same space as the paints

Effect The brushes animate and attempt to paint all creatures within 30 feet. The creatures must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:41] save to avoid the brushes and splashes from paint cans or be converted into living artwork for 1 hour.

A creature that becomes living artwork is immediately bound to the nearest flat surface of its size or larger within 30 feet. The creature can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

While bound to a surface, the creature can attack from its space as normal, including against other creatures bound to the same surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} spell or a wall being demolished), the creature takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the creature is destroyed.

weapon->+3 Greater Striking speed Handwr.name: +3 Greater Striking speed Handwraps of Mighty Blows
weapon->+3 Greater Striking speed Handwr.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Double Punch.name: Double Punch
action->Double Punch.description: Lord Guirden makes two fist Strikes, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after both Strikes.

action->Hurl.name: Hurl
action->Hurl.description:
Requirements Lord Guirden has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed

Effect Lord Guirden hurls the grabbed creature into a target adjacent to him. He makes a fist Strike against the adjacent target. On a success, the target and hurled creature both take 3d10+14 bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. On a failure, only the thrown creature takes the damage and is knocked prone.

action->Master Brawler.name: Master Brawler
action->Master Brawler.description: Whenever Lord Guirden makes a fist Strike and hits, he can choose to apply either the Grab, Knockdown, or Push ability to his attack.

Lusca.name: Lusca
Lusca.publicNotes: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
The lusca gains 2 extra reactions at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with its jaws. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action.

Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: The lusca can smell blood in the water up to 1 mile away.

action->Storm Bringer.name: Storm Bringer
action->Storm Bringer.description: When the lusca is near the surface for more than 1 hour, clouds appear and deliver a thunderstorm with a 2-mile radius centered on its location. The weather returns to normal 1 hour after the lusca departs.

action->Capsize.name: Capsize
action->Capsize.description: The lusca tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the lusca) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

action->Lusca Venom.name: Lusca Venom
action->Lusca Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 6d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

action->Ravenous Jaws.name: Ravenous Jaws
action->Ravenous Jaws.description: The lusca makes three jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the lusca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the lusca makes all of these attacks. If the lusca subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Ravenous Jaws.

Maurrisa Jonne.name: Maurrisa Jonne
Maurrisa Jonne.saveDetails: +1 status bonus to saves vs. incapacitation effects, +2 status bonus to saves vs. Shove and Trip

weapon->+1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.FNDq4NFSN0g2HKWO]

action->+1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Inc.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Incapacitation Effects

action->+2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Sho.name: +2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Shove

action->+2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Tri.name: +2 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Trip

action->Duck and Weave.name: Duck and Weave
action->Duck and Weave.description:
Trigger A creature misses two consecutive melee Strikes against Maurrisa

Effect Maurrisa takes advantage of a flailing foe's opening. She can either Step 5 feet or make a melee Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Rabbit Punch.name: Rabbit Punch
action->Rabbit Punch.description:
Trigger Maurrisa can make an Attack of Opportunity

Effect Maurrisa chops her opponent on the back of the head or neck, possibly concussing them.

The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save. On a failure, the creature takes damage as if hit by Maurrisa's fist Strike, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} instead.

spell->Tongues (Constant).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
Tongues (Constant)

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The minchgorm Grabs a creature in its jaws

Effect The minchgorm uses Swallow Whole.

action->Riptide.name: Riptide
action->Riptide.description: Tentacles of water rise up and attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} all enemies within 15 feet of the minchgorm. The minchgorm attempts an @Check[athletics] check against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. On a success, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 40). On a critical success, or a success against a creature that is already grabbed, the target begins to drown.

action->Watery Simulacra.name: Watery Simulacra
action->Watery Simulacra.description: The minchgorm raises up to eight figures from nearby water, each appearing in an empty space within 60 feet of the minchgorm. A simulacrum can take any shape of size Medium or smaller that the minchgorm desires, including that of a specific individual or object, but is always plainly made of water. The minchgorm can speak, cast spells, and use its senses through its simulacra, spending actions for a simulacrum on a one-for-one basis. By using a single action with the concentrate trait, the minchgorm can cause any number of simulacra to Fly, Step, Stride, or Swim up to 60 feet. A simulacrum uses the minchgorm's AC and saving throws and has 30 Hit Points. A minchgorm can have up to eight simulacra in existence at once. Simulacra dissolve immediately when more than 60 feet from the minchgorm, or if the minchgorm dies or falls unconscious. The minchgorm can dismiss any number of its simulacra as a free action.

Miogimo.name: Miogimo
Miogimo.saveDetails: +1 status bonus to Will saves vs. mental effects

spell->Freedom of Movement.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]
Freedom of Movement

spell->Veil.name: Veil
spell->Veil.description:
You disguise the targets as other creatures of the same body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds). The disguise can hide the targets' identities or let them appear to be of another ancestry, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell doesn't change voice, scent, or mannerisms. You choose the disguise for each target; for example, you could make one target appear to be a dwarf and another an elf. Casting veil counts as setting up a disguise for the purpose of the Impersonate action. It allows the target to ignore any circumstance penalties they might take for being disguised as dissimilar creatures, and it gives the targets a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through their disguises, and add their level even if untrained. You can Dismiss any or all of these disguises.

Heightened (5th) The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (7th) The targets can appear as any creature of the same size, even specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to reproduce their appearance. The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

spell->Geas.target: 1 creature of a level no greater than double the geas ritual's level

spell->Illusory Creature (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]
Illusory Creature (At Will)

action->Little Favors.name: Little Favors
action->Little Favors.description: Each time a creature willingly performs a service, quest, or task for the zealborn, the creature takes a cumulative -1 status penalty to saving throws against the zealborn's mental spells and abilities (maximum -4).

action->+1 Status to Will Saves vs. Ment.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+1 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When Miogimo is destroyed, he re-forms, fully healed, near a follower of his choice in [[/br 1d10 #Rejuvenation]]{1d10 days}. For the purposes of rejuvenation, a follower is defined as an intelligent creature who's well acquainted with Miogimo and is a true believer in Miogimo's mission, not merely a lukewarm supporter. Miogimo can be permanently destroyed only if he has no current followers or can be convinced to end his own life.

action->Trickster's Ace.name: Trickster's Ace
action->Trickster's Ace.description:
Trigger An effect would cause Miogimo to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or would slow his movement

Effect Miogimo casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement} on himself.

action->Zealous Restoration.name: Zealous Restoration
action->Zealous Restoration.description: Miogimo can't regain Hit Points through resting or void healing; he feeds only on the idealism of his supporters, regaining 10 Hit Points per day for each creature under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q690d3mw3TUrKX7E]{Geas} cast by Miogimo. Creatures under Miogimo's geas have their maximum HP reduced by 10 each day until they are burned away to a husk and perish. After 24 hours, such creatures rise as zeal-damned ghouls under Miogimo's control. Zeal-damned ghouls eat only the flesh of evil or chaotic creatures and deal an additional 1d6 spirit and 1d6 void damage with their attacks.

spell->Mage Hand.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mage Hand

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.e4NwsnPnpQKbDZ9F]

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.tH5GirEy7YB3ZgCk]

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.88pGCHV0uKMskTVO]

Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

consumable->Giant Centipede Venom.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.txmX5ghhPS72GKXy]

Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 17 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

consumable->Invisibility Potion.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]

An invisibility potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank invisibility spell.

action->Supersonic Hearing.name: Supersonic Hearing
action->Supersonic Hearing.description: Mobana has spent years in close proximity to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.k9BYXA4b7Z4Hy6lZ]{Deafening Music Box} in her possession and is immune to its effects. She also gains a +2 circumstance bonus against sonic effects and effects that impose the deafened condition

action->Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
action->Swift Sneak.description: Mobana can move her full speed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaking}.

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
action->Deny Advantage.description: Mobana isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Mobana is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see.

Effect Mobana gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
action->Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements Mobana is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand.

Effect Mobana applies a poison to the weapon.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: Mobana Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Mobana deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

action->Ooze Tendril.name: Ooze Tendril
action->Ooze Tendril.description: Mother Venom can command her minions and the oozes that cover her dungeon to attack foes. As long as she's conscious, she can make melee ooze tendril Strikes that originate from any slime-covered terrain in her dungeon, including the dungeon's walls and doors, or from a space occupied by one of her children of venom.

action->Spit.name: Spit
action->Spit.description: A creature hit by Mother Venom's spit attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface (Escape DC 38).

Mr. Snips.name: Mr. Snips
Mr. Snips.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by acid (6d10+4, 2d8+4 from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area 2d8+4 HP); slowed by electricity

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem. Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical. Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical. Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be slowed 1 for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round. Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

action->Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
action->Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a 10-foot radius centered on the corner of one of the iron golem's squares. The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem's poison. The golem can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Dismember.name: Dismember
action->Dismember.description:
Whenever Mr. Snips rolls a critical hit with a scissors Strike, in addition to dealing extra damage, the golem has a chance to dismember its victim. The target must roll a @Check[reflex|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]].

Critical Failure As failure, and one of the targets extremities is severed (the effects of this are up to the GM's discretion).

action->Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
action->Inexorable March.description: The iron golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.

action->Iron Golem Poison.name: Iron Golem Poison
action->Iron Golem Poison.description:
Any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:35]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 2d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 8d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round).

equipment->Cloak of the Bat (Greater).name: Cloak of the Bat (Greater)
equipment->Cloak of the Bat (Greater).description:
Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Frequency any number of times per day

Effect You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} spell on you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ioGzmVSmMGXWWBYb]{Effect: Cloak of the Bat}

0.label: Cloak of the Bat, Maneuver in Flight

equipment->Heartstone.name: Heartstone
equipment->Heartstone.description:
This gemstone grants its wearer a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Each heartstone is powered by the spirit of a specific night hag. If it's separated from her for 24 hours (or she's been dead for 24 hours), it becomes a nonmagical gemstone. A heartstone allows the hag to use additional occult innate spells: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} (9th level) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} at will, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} twice per day.

Activate A command

Requirements You must be touching the heartstone.

Effect The heartstone attempts to counteract one disease affecting you (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier +18).

Craft Requirements You must be a night hag.

action->Nightmare Rider.name: Nightmare Rider
action->Nightmare Rider.description: When a night hag rides a nightmare, the nightmare also gains the night hag's status bonus to saves against magic, and both the hag and rider benefit when the night hag uses her heartstone's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} innate spell.

action->Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
action->Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

action->Abyssal Plague.name: Abyssal Plague
action->Abyssal Plague.description:
A creature can't recover from drained until Abyssal plague is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:41]

Stage 1 drained 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 drained 3 (1 day)

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The night hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Dream Haunting.name: Dream Haunting
action->Dream Haunting.description: If a night hag is ethereal and hovering over a sleeping chaotic or evil creature, she can ride the victim's back until dawn. The creature endures tormenting dreams as the hag casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} on it, and is exposed to abyssal plague. Any drained caused by dream haunting is cumulative. Only an ethereal being can confront the night hag and stop her dream haunting.

action->Spell Ambush.name: Spell Ambush
action->Spell Ambush.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the night hag takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.

action->Odorless.name: Odorless
action->Odorless.description: A myrucarx emits no smell and can't be detected by scent.

action->Painful Light.name: Painful Light
action->Painful Light.description: When attempting a save against a light effect, a myrucarx gets a result one degree of success lower than it rolled. A myrucarx caught in sunlight is stunned 2 and clumsy 2.

action->Illusory Persona.name: Illusory Persona
action->Illusory Persona.description: The illusion created by the myrucarx's project image can resemble any Medium humanoid, including any specific individual it has seen, and has appropriate voice, scent, and mannerisms, allowing the myrucarx to use its Deception check to Impersonate that humanoid if it chooses.

action->Twisting Reach.name: Twisting Reach
action->Twisting Reach.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The fanged mouths at the ends of a myrucarx's tendrils twist around obstacles. The myrucarx makes two jaws Strikes against the same target, ignoring the target's cover. Both attacks count toward the myrucarx's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. The myrucarx can't Grab as its next action after Twisting Reach.

action->Shared Diversion.name: Shared Diversion
action->Shared Diversion.description:
Trigger Another creature in the najra lizard's square succeeds at a Deception check to Create a Diversion

Effect The najra lizard automatically successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Creates a Diversion} against the same targets.

action->Najra Lizard Venom.name: Najra Lizard Venom
action->Najra Lizard Venom.description:
The creature is extremely thirsty and can't quench its thirst while poisoned

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, and [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage} that can't be recovered until the creature quenches its thirst (1 round)

Stage 2 as stage 1 (1 hour)

action->Najra Swarm Attack.name: Najra Swarm Attack
action->Najra Swarm Attack.description: The najra lizard's melee Strikes deal 1d6 precision damage to creatures sharing a square with more than one najra lizard.

Needling Stairs.name: Needling Stairs
Needling Stairs.description: This staircase has springs in each step, which send poisoned needles shooting up through tiny holes in the wood when stepped on. Each step, 6 in total, takes up one 5-foot square.
Needling Stairs.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Stair Spring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on each stair to disable its spring, or deactivate the switch in area C8 to deactivate the whole trap. Cutting the wire on the topmost stair (>@Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Cut Wire on Top-Most Stair|traits:action:disable-a-device] to Disable the Device) that connects the staircase to the control switch prevents the control switch from turning the trap on or off.
Needling Stairs.hpDetails: to break the spring under the step and make that step safe to stand on
Needling Stairs.reset: If deactivated via the switch, the trap can be reactivated with the switch in area C8.
Needling Stairs.routine: (1 action) The trap makes a separate poisoned needle Strike against each creature currently on an active step as 1 action. Because it is constantly jabbing needles up through any weight-bearing steps, the trap can also use its Bloody Feet free action to jab at a creature on one of the steps during that creature's turn.

action->First Step.name: First Step
action->First Step.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement on one of the stairs

Effect The trap makes a poisoned needle Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

strike-melee->Poisoned Needle.name: Poisoned Needle
strike-melee->Poisoned Needle.description: No MAP applies to strikes made by poisoned needle attacks

action->Bloody Feet.name: Bloody Feet
action->Bloody Feet.description:
Trigger A creature moves onto an active step

Effect The trap makes a poisoned needle Strike against the triggering creature.

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: The Poisoned Needle Strikes do not apply a MAP.
